summary: SummaryA sheer, illuminating tinted moisturizer with light-bending effects. This formula is infused with good-for-skin ingredients including hyaluronic acid, shea butter, squalane and vitamin E.
details: DetailsBenefitsImmediately evens skin toneBlurs and diffuses blemishesProvides immediate hydrationLong-wearing, 8 hoursNon-fading, 8 hoursStays color-true, 8 hoursProvides anti-pollution protection and anti-blue light protection74% naturally derived**Per ISO Standard 16128. From plant sources, non-petroleum mineral sources and/or water.Key IngredientsShea Butter, Hyaluronic Acid, Squalane & Vitamin E: Helps protect skin barrier, hydrates and restores the skinContains 78.65% skincare ingredientsFeaturesIlluminating tinted moisturizerHydratingGel-balm texture that cocoons skin for a comfortable, soft all-over glow with a sheer buildable coverageItem 2624862How To UseApply to face using fingertips, sponge or a 159S Brush.Blend or build to desired coverage.Wear alone for a dewy glow, under foundation for a lit-from-within look or beneath powder for a radiant matte finish.IngredientsWater\Aqua\Eau, Hydrogenated Didecene, Glycerin, Propanediol, Isoamyl Laurate, Squalane, Cetyl Peg/Ppg-10/1 Dimethicone, Soybean Glycerides, Hydrogenated Styrene/ Isoprene Copolymer, Polyglyceryl-4 Isostearate, Sodium Chloride, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter Unsaponifiables, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Root Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Caprylyl Glycol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Disodium Edta, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Hydroxyacetophenone, Tocopheryl Acetate, Bht, Phenoxyethanol, [+/- Mica, Titanium Dioxide (Ci77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Iron Oxides (CI 77499), Bismuth Oxychloride (CI 77163), Blue 1 Lake (CI 42090), Chromium Hydroxide Green (CI 77289), Chromium Oxide Greens (CI 77288), Ferricammonium Ferrocyanide (CI 77510), Ferric Ferrocyanide (CI 77510), Manganese Violet (CI 77742), Red 6 (Ci15850), Red 7 Lake (CI 15850), Red 28 Lake (CI 45410), Red 30 Lake (CI 73360), Ultramarines (CI 77007), Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140), Yellow 6 Lake (CI 15985)]Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Apply to face using fingertips, sponge or a 159S Brush.Blend or build to desired coverage.Wear alone for a dewy glow, under foundation for a lit-from-within look or beneath powder for a radiant matte finish.

reviews.headline: Yes
reviews.comments: Love it

reviews.headline: Oily
reviews.comments: I gave it a try 2 dayd and I was extremely oliy/shining. It's a no for me.

reviews.headline: Drying
reviews.comments: I really wanted to like this product  but I didn't find this dewy at all.  My skin is mature and i applied moisturizer prior to, but it was  just too drying.

reviews.headline: It looks like highlighter all over your face
reviews.comments: It's okay but I wouldn't buy again, putting powder over top will help reduce the shine. I don't recommend this for oily skin.

reviews.headline: Perfection!!
reviews.comments: I have pre-aging skin and this tint is amazing! Very glowy, light, and stays all day, even wearing a mask at work. Highly recommend!!

reviews.headline: love it
reviews.comments: a little goes a LONG way. I mix just a drop with a light foundation and it looks beautiful. its helped me with softening some of my more matte foundations which can make my skin feel (and look) dry. I will say, I got it on sale and idk if I'd pay full price. for me, the elf halo glow does about the same job although it doesn't feel quite as nice on the skin when it first goes on as MAC, once it dries theres not much difference. you DO get more bang for your buck because you deserve considerably less of the MAC for what youd have to use of the ELF so....

reviews.headline: love it
reviews.comments: a little goes a LONG way. I mix just a drop with a light foundation and it looks beautiful. its helped me with softening some of my more matte foundations which can make my skin feel (and look) dry. I will say, I got it on sale and idk if I'd pay full price. for me, the elf halo glow does about the same job although it doesn't feel quite as nice on the skin when it first goes on as MAC, once it dries theres not much difference. you DO get more bang for your buck because you deserve considerably less of the MAC for what youd have to use of the ELF so....

reviews.headline: The best skin tint < 3
reviews.comments: I absolutely love this skin tint so much! The formula is so light and hydrating, it doesn't even feel like im wearing makeup. It gives such a beautiful glow to the skin. I really hope this product never gets discontinued, its truly a staple in my routine!

reviews.headline: 100% no!  0 stars
reviews.comments: I never write reviews but this is the worst product I've purchased in recent years.  The painted logo on the tube chips off in silver glitter like tiny particles,  is all over my products and face daily.  I hate it!

reviews.headline: Loved the finish
reviews.comments: Wore this out for 8 hours in the arizona summer heat, (with setting spray of course) but was surprised with the last, and the finish. Doesnt feel cakey and didnt settle into fine lines thru out the day

reviews.headline: Love this for Summer Glow!!!
reviews.comments: If you have fairly decent skin, this is a great product!  If you have a lot of discoloration, this is not the product for you.

reviews.headline: Exactly what it says
reviews.comments: Hardly ever am I completely won over by product. I am usually a full foundation girlie, but this has me changing things up. Love the glow without it being over the top. I do apply concealer in addition and its perfect. Great product!

reviews.headline: EPIC FAIL
reviews.comments:
I received a sample of the Mac tint at Ulta. I put in over my regular skin prep routine. Within  10 minutes it oxidized to a copper penny shade. I looked like an oompa-loompa. I tried it over three different moisturizers and got the same results. I even tried it on my bare skin. Also, it has an almost cartoonish shine to it. I just turned 60, so maybe it is not meant for mature skin. 
I have a lot of Mac products.  I think their paint pots are amazing. In my opinion,  Mac really missed the mark on this one.

reviews.headline: i would not reccomand this
reviews.comments: I will not recommand this product

reviews.headline: Not for me
reviews.comments:
I returned this. 

I have dry skin for reference. This clung to and emphasized evergrhing. The shine is way, way too much for me. Even with setting it down a bit i just could not get this to work for me.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Very light tent love it

reviews.headline: Had to wash off after an hour - so SHINY
reviews.comments: I looked like I had metallic skin. Actually laughed at myself. If that's what you're going for, buy it, but I don't wan to look like I applied sunscreen and then sweated by 10 hours when I haven't. It felt SO heavy on my skin too.

reviews.headline: Toxic
reviews.comments: I purchased recently without reading the ingredients. The Yuka app rated this product poor due to too many toxins, so I will be returning. Wake up America! Stop buying toxic products if you care about your health.

reviews.headline: Got compliments on my skin texture!
reviews.comments: It's called dewy for a reason, a little goes a long way for me. I will say beware the packaging because the bottom part split open not too soon after I purchased it and product exploded out. I had some duct tape to the rescue but other than that I love!

reviews.headline: Great skin tint!
reviews.comments: I've been looking for a light coverage that is also gentle on my skin. I have dry skin so skin  tint is perfect as it is light, a little goes a long way, and a glowy finish that lasts all day! Love it!

faceoff_positive.comments:
One thing about me? I love tinted moisturizers. They are the linchpin to my skincare routine and the only real "makeup" product I use on a daily basis. So when I was offered the opportunity to review this product as part of a free sample program, I jumped on it. 

The instructions say to apply with fingertips, which is how I usually apply my tinted moisturizers, so when it arrived I dove right in and started applying after the rest of my skincare had been completed. The first thing you notice about this product is just how thique it is - almost like a water mixed clay. 

Because of its consistency, I found it was a bit reluctant to move/blend on the skin - a blessing for lasting power, a curse for application. I've watched several video reviews of the product since my first demo, and they all recommended using brushes for application, a sentiment I echo wholeheartedly. 

Upon first application I was not very impressed. There was an orange hue that I had trouble blending into my skin tone,  and the way it interacted with my UV protecting primer created a whitecast that I've never experienced before. This made the shine look artificial as if it were sitting on top of my skin, rather than a natural part of my complexion. 

What I'll say about this product in general is that the dry down is key. Even after days of use, during which I felt I had gotten a better handle on how to apply the product, I felt dissatisfied with how I looked immediately after application. But 30 minutes after, once the product had dried? My skin was beautiful. And it stayed that way for the rest of the day - through naps, long walks in dry heat, all the way through my nighttime skincare routine. I was impressed by the staying power and the increasingly natural look it provided. 

It took a while for this product to grow on me, but once you learn how to use it. May not be as "easy" as other products, but worth the money if you have the time (and a brush).
faceoff_positive.headline: Learn It to Love It

faceoff_negative.comments:
[I was provided a free sample of the Strobe Dewy Skin Tint in Light 3 to review by MAC through BzzAgent.]

For context, I have dry combination skin and usually use the Bobbi Brown Skin Long-Wear Weightless Foundation in Sand N-032.

I received the shade Light 3, and I found it a little darker and more orange/peachy than I expected, but it is sheer and blendable enough to get away with a slight tint mismatch.

I have mixed feelings about this foundation. It is really pretty from afar, but when you get even a little close it looks a little greasy and too shiny. If you like that look but don't want too much glitter/shimmer, then this is the right product for you. I tried putting my regular foundation on top but you could still see the effect of the tint, so I wouldn't recommend layering with this either if you intend to try to layer this to have a softer effect. I did try to powder and it did help and gave me that soft, glow-from-within look I wanted, but it quickly got cakey and then you could really see all my pores. I also found this tint to have some transfer and stickiness, as expected from a skin tint. This is also a little heavier than I expected from a tint so it had some decent coverage and was layerable. TLDR; if you want to glow and shine and want the skincare benefits of a tint with the coverage of a buildable foundation, get this! If you don't want to have too much shine or want something lightweight and/or transfer-proof, I would pass on this product.
faceoff_negative.headline: Super glowy and shiny
